examples: Life expectancy in England rose to 41 years by 1820, 50 years by the early 20th century, and 78 years today.
In India and China, life expectancy has risen by 30 years since 1950.
Except for a few exceptions, life expectancy never rose above 35 or below 25.
Their average life expectancy is 48.
In just the past century, however, life expectancy has increased by over 30 years.
words.defineEn: something expected (as on the basis of a norm)
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó mong đợi (như trên cơ sở của một tiêu chuẩn)

words.defineEn: discharge (phlegm or sputum) from the lungs and out of the mouth
words.defineVi: tiết dịch (đờm hoặc đờm) từ phổi và ra khỏi miệng

words.defineEn: the termination or destruction of union
words.defineVi: chấm dứt hoặc phá hủy công đoàn

examples: Your clients will come to distrust you if you keep promising them the world and then inevitably fail to deliver.
But many citizens feel distrust toward the EU.
First the politicians are distrusted, and next the institutions.
There's a lot of distrust of Chinese influence in the country.
There was this distrust of the government.
words.defineEn: regard as untrustworthy; regard with suspicion; have no faith or confidence in
words.defineVi: coi là không đáng tin cậy; nghi ngờ; không có niềm tin hay sự tự tin trong

examples: They thought it was the greatest thing in the world that people were so distraught about their tone and coverage that they would write about it or talk about it.
Baby monkeys that are allowed to see, hear and smell, but not touch their mamas become extremely distraught.
I approached them 'cause I was so distraught and so sad about the state of things.

Mary is very visibly distraught, confused, even angry, which sets her apart from past depictions showing Mary at peace, following the Catholic belief that she had the foreknowledge that Jesus would rise from the dead.
words.defineEn: very upset and overwhelmed with strong emotions like sadness, worry, or despair
words.defineVi: rất khó chịu và tràn ngập những cảm xúc mạnh mẽ như buồn bã, lo lắng hoặc tuyệt vọng

examples: She served in the medical corps.
I mean, the entire national press corps descended.
According to the Corps, every Marine is first and foremost a rifleman.
I’m not going to back down from the press corps.
He left the Corps in 2013 after a tumultuous turn running U.S. Central Command under President Obama.
words.defineEn: an army unit usually consisting of two or more divisions and their support
words.defineVi: một đơn vị quân đội thường bao gồm hai hoặc nhiều bộ phận và sự hỗ trợ của họ

examples: But he doesn’t take corporeal form like the Greek and Roman Gods do.

Part of that belief is that most nonhuman entities are capable of changing into whatever corporeal body they wish, as if changing clothes, meaning the altering physical depictions of the Kasogonagá across cultures are not seen as unusual.
words.defineEn: having material or physical form or substance
words.defineVi: có vật chất hoặc hình thức vật lý hoặc chất

examples: If women want to climb the corporate ladder, they may have to sacrifice some of their family life.
Corporate interests really ramped up their spending on this.
Some of that involves corporate philanthropy.
Along with architecture and furnishings and branding, art can communicate corporate identity.
Corporate art isn’t always kept inside offices, either.
words.defineVi: liên quan đến một công ty lớn

examples: At this point, France was still at war with Austria and Britain, wars that France ended up winning, largely thanks to a little corporal named Napoleon Bonaparte.
words.defineEn: possessing or existing in bodily form
words.defineVi: sở hữu hoặc tồn tại ở dạng cơ thể

examples: He felt a tickling sensation as a butterfly landed on his cheek.
He bravely took a bite of the spicy chilli and instantly felt a fiery sensation in his mouth.
As soon as the vinegar touched her lips, she could feel the mouth-puckering sensation.
She enjoyed the cooling sensation of spearmint chewing gum as it freshened her breath.
After a series of failed albums, Emily's music career got a new lease on life when her latest single became a viral sensation.
words.defineEn: a physical perception caused by an outside stimulus or something being in touch with the body
words.defineVi: một nhận thức vật lý gây ra bởi một kích thích bên ngoài hoặc một cái gì đó tiếp xúc với cơ thể

examples: In his book Thinking about Crime: Sense and Sensibility in American Penal Culture Professor Michael Tonry notes that nations with remarkably similar crime rates often have vastly different sentencing and punishment standards.
I mean, he still alienates a lot of people, he still reflects an awful lot of sensibilities that are problematic for many constituents here.
First off, we're not talking about minimalism as a general sensibility or the life-changing magic of tidying up.
And Elinor Dashwood, who fiercely protects her family at the cost of her own desires in "Sense and Sensibility."
What did he do that most offended their Italian sensibilities, when they first met?
words.defineVi: phản ứng tinh thần và nhận thức

words.defineEn: the areas of the brain that process and register incoming sensory information and make possible the conscious awareness of the world
words.defineVi: các khu vực của bộ não xử lý và đăng ký thông tin giác quan đến và có thể nhận thức có ý thức về thế giới

examples: The interneurons in the spinal cord help to relay signals from sensory neurons to motor neurons, allowing for coordinated movements.
At first detection of low water levels, sensory receptors in the brain's hypothalamus signal the release of antidiuretic hormone.
Ongoing neural activity also underlies our sensory perception.
Enter: sensory deprivation.
Most sensory neurons are unipolar.
words.defineEn: of a nerve fiber or impulse originating outside and passing toward the central nervous system
words.defineVi: của một sợi thần kinh hoặc xung động bắt nguồn từ bên ngoài và đi về phía hệ thống thần kinh trung ương

examples: That's very sensual.
But he was only thinking of their sensual needs.
This week's episode was brought to you by the hard work of these sensual objects.
It's very sensual, though, I like it when you.
Well, let's talk about the sensual needs first.
words.defineEn: relating to or involving the senses or physical sensation
words.defineVi: liên quan đến hoặc liên quan đến các giác quan hoặc cảm giác vật lý

examples: Titian’s masterful handling of paint, building up layer after translucent layer, gives her a soft and sensuous glow.
It's delicious, soothing, sensuous, and it's had a hold on us for thousands of years.
He claims that he has gone to Haiti and he has watched this sort of primal, wicked, lustful, um, movement dance, and it's sensuous and it's uninhibited.

words.defineVi: (thường được theo sau bởi `for') cực kỳ ham muốn

examples: He's living on a higher astral plane.
words.defineEn: being or relating to or resembling or emanating from stars
words.defineVi: là hoặc liên quan đến hoặc giống hoặc phát ra từ các ngôi sao
